instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan at max rpm and only one is spinning
threads.message:
Titles says it. When I turn the board on one fan kicks up to max speed immediately. The other does absolutely nothing. Was fixing an audio issue around <CHIP>U6400</CHIP> but cannot say whether or not that's when it started. I can confirm once upon a time the board worked fine though. Not sure if it was damaged from being in a pile or from me fixing audio.

Edit:
<SIGNAL>FAN_RT_PWM</SIGNAL> - 4.88v
<SIGNAL>FAN_LT_PWM</SIGNAL> - 0v

Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR> or is it something else?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan at max rpm and only one is spinning
threads.message:
Compare diode mode to ground readings between <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR>/50 areas.
Check for knocked off component, or broken trace.
